DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for prostate carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain N Category Prostate Gland Neoplasm Pathologic
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredName: Prostate Gland Neoplasm Pathologic N Category
Property.preferredDefinition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ylu

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of prostate cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with no positive regional nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with no positive regional nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with metastases in regional node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with metastases in regional node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Prostate Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prostate Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer in which the regional nodes were not assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer in which the regional nodes were not assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
